page.title: 13Health and Hospital
page.content: The{Cottage Hospital}in Bourton-on- the-Water was built in 1879 and an extension was added in 1972. There are 40, mostly part-time, nursing staff and doctors come from 2 local practices. The hospital has{34 beds and{12 day patients}can be catered for in a separate building. The hospital beds are usually full, most patients being old. The{commonest ailments}are varicose ulcers, stroke damage and fractured femurs. On average, the long term patients stay for 2 months. The hospital caters for a total of{35 {surrounding villages.}The Doctors Surgery in Bourton has{4 doctors}who care for about{2000 patients each.}The surgery covers a 20 mile radius around Bourton and the doctors travel about 50 miles each day normally visiting about 5 patients. About 35 patients visit the surgery each day.
